entries.description: The filesystem patch the pointers to the JVM Cache for the current node are held
The directory that contains a JDBC 2.0 compliant driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 Legacy CLI-based Type 2 JDBC Driver (db2java.zip).
The directory that contains the native JDBC Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the IBM Toolbox JDBC Driver for remote DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains the DB2 JDBC Driver on zSeries.
The directory that contains the Informix JCC Driver.
The directory that contains the Informix JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the Sybase JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the Oracle thin or oci8 JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the DataDirect Connect for JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server.
The directory that contains the Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC Driver (db2jcc.jar).

Specifies the fully qualified name of the directory containing native files (e.g., .so files) needed by the DB2 Universal JDBC Driver for type 2 connectivity. Normally the value should be left null. The only time a value should be specified is under WAS z/OS when DB2 V8 or higher is installed. In this case, there are .so files that are installed which are needed for DB2 Universal JDBC Driver processing.
The directory that contains the native JDBC 4.0 Driver for local DB2 connections on iSeries.
The directory that contains native files needed by the Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver.
The directory that contains the IBM Data Server (JCC) Driver (db2jcc4.jar).

The directory that contains the native client code needed by the IBM Data Server (JCC) Driver for type 2 connectivity. The value should be left null if the path to the native client code has already been specified by the environment in which the application server is running.
The filesystem path to the WebSphere product installation directory.
The filesystem path to the user installaton directory.
The filesystem path to the product lib directory.
The filesystem path to the product properties directory.
The filesystem path to the product temp directory.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed enterprise applications.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain server log files.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain drivers.
The filesystem path to the Java Virtual Machine installation directory.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere MQ client libraries.
The filesystem path to the installation directory for WebSphere EJB Deployment tool.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain installed connectors.
The filesystem path to the directory which will contain etc config files.
The directory that contains the DB2 Universal JDBC driver license file.
The directory that contains the Derby jar files.
The product library for the i5/OS WebSphere product installation.
The name used to refer to the localhost interface.
